Literature Review: Nanoparticles have revolutionized the field of cell signaling by providing a novel approach to interrogate and manipulate the complex signaling processes within cells. The unique physical and chemical properties of nanoparticles make them an ideal tool for quantitative measurements and manipulation of cell signaling. This review aims to summarize the pioneering studies that have developed and applied nanoparticles for cell signaling, from the measurement of signaling molecules to the spatiotemporal manipulation of cell signal transduction.
